Welcome to this (not yet) great documentation!¶

Our own made promaci functions for easy developing and debugging¶

utils.CropImage(im, bbox)[source]¶

Crop an image based on a box given by the selectROI function

im: image

bbox: bounding box selected previously by cv2.selectROI

utils.drawTrajectory(pts, im)[source]¶

Draw the points based on a list of (x,y) coordinates to in image, cv2.polylines can also be used.

pts: (x,y) list from points to draw

im: image where the trajectory will be coloured

Change the BGR(255, 255, 255) parameter to draw on a different colour

utils.draw_str(dst, target, s)[source]¶

Draw a string on an image

dst: image to write string

target: position where string will be drawn, remember that origin is on the upper left part of the image

s: string to be drawn

utils.videoToImgs(dir, video_name, video_extension, im_extension)[source]¶

Convert all frames of a video into images and save them on a given folder, it automatically creates the new folder

dir: directory where images will be saved

video_name: name of video without extension

video_extension: string with the extension of the video, without the point (.), e.g. “avi”

im_extension: string with the desired extensions for the imates, without the point (.), e.g. “png”

utils.blobFeatures(bin)[source]¶

SimpleBlobDetedtor works by doing different thresholds to the iamge (let’s say every 10 levels of intensity) between a min and a max thresh value, with this it is determined which connected regions are present in most of the thresholds done and therefore are more likely to be our actual particles, They can be then filtered by size or shape with further parameters

In our case, the simple blob detector gets a binary image, so it is mostly used to filter blobs by the different parameters.

It returns the kepoints of the DETECTED blobs. So we use it as detector.

utils.imageBinarization(img)[source]¶

Produces the binary image by applying gaussian blurring, threshold, erosion and opening

img: initial image from video

bin: resulting binary image

blur_img: grayscale image with median blurring

The morphological operations can be modified for improved results, the threshold is done via Otsu, i.e it searchs the best threshold value automatically.

Blob Class¶

class utils.Blob(region, label)[source]¶

Class blob to organize blobs and positions belonging to them

region: positions conforming this blob

centroid: mass centre from blob

label: labelling number assigned to this blob

blobChecked: boolean indicator if this blob was already revised by Blob.pointInBlob

size: number of points conforming this blob

lastTrackPos: stores the position of this blob on the last frame

pointInBlob(keypoint)[source]¶

Determines if a given point belongs to this blob.

Parameters:keypoint – point to be analised
Returns:true or false if the analided keypoint belongs to the blob
showColouredBlob(drawing)[source]¶

Draws the current blob

Parameters:drawing – image to draw the blob, normally an empty dark image with 3 channels
Returns:-1 -> It automatically shows the image on a new window
